questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the stack in a pushdown automaton (PDA)?

answers.b: To store intermediate results during computation.

explanations.b: Correct! The stack in a PDA is used to store intermediate results during computation.

questions.question: What distinguishes a pushdown automaton (PDA) from a finite automaton (FA)?

answers.a: The PDA has an infinite tape.
answers.b: The PDA has a stack for additional memory.
answers.c: The PDA uses transition rules instead of states.
answers.d: The PDA recognizes only regular languages.

explanations.b: Correct! A key distinction is that a PDA has a stack for additional memory, unlike a finite automaton.

questions.question: Which statement is true regarding pushdown automata (PDAs)?

answers.b: PDAs are strictly more powerful than Turing machines.
answers.c: PDAs use only transition rules for computation.

explanations.d: Correct! PDAs can recognize context-free languages.
